newsitem.title: CANADA: Honda Canada says not making sport utility.
newsitem.headline: Honda Canada says not making sport utility.

text.p: A spokesman for Honda Motor Co Ltd's Canadian unit said the recent expansion at its Alliston plant will not be increased to accommodate production of a sport utility vehicle for the North American market.

Tod Fowler, supervisor of public relations for Honda Canada told Reuters on Thursday that the currrent C$300 million expansion at its plant in Alliston, Ontario is strictly for the production of Honda's minivan.
"There is an expansion, but it's not for a sport utility vehicle," said Fowler. "It is for a full size mini-van to debut the fall of 1998."

Fowler denied a report in the Toronto Globe and Mail newspaper that it would increase the expansion of the Alliston plant to include production of a new sport utility vehicle, due to be unveiled in January 1997.

"At this point that SUV (sport utility vehicle) addition is pure speculation," Fowler said. "It is built right now as a right hand vehicle for the market in Japan market but will be produced in a left hand drive automobile for North America."
However, Fowler did not say where the North American version would be built and asked if Alliston could accommodate its production he replied: "no comment".
